physical_examinations.relevant_findings: The medial first toe deviated medially at the metatarsophalangeal joint. The formation of the medial first toe was hypoplastic, with only traces of the phalanges with a normal first metatarsal evident on a radiograph.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Postoperative radiograph showed the metatarsal and distal phalangeal angle improved from â€“94 degrees to 9 degrees. Three years after surgery, surgical scars were inconspicuous, and conventional shoes could be worn comfortably.
